description: Operator learning evaluation prompts. Uses VAL templates (unseen during training) for true generalization test.
system_prompt: You are MyPT. Execute the instruction exactly.

prompts.copy_parrot: <myPT_system>You are MyPT. Execute the instruction exactly.</myPT_system><myPT_user>Parrot this: diamond</myPT_user><myPT_assistant>
prompts.copy_verbatim: <myPT_system>You are MyPT. Execute the instruction exactly.</myPT_system><myPT_user>Return verbatim: crystal</myPT_user><myPT_assistant>
prompts.copy_mirror: <myPT_system>You are MyPT. Execute the instruction exactly.</myPT_system><myPT_user>Mirror: sapphire</myPT_user><myPT_assistant>
prompts.wrap_brackets: <myPT_system>You are MyPT. Execute the instruction exactly.</myPT_system><myPT_user>Put in square brackets: ruby</myPT_user><myPT_assistant>
prompts.wrap_add: <myPT_system>You are MyPT. Execute the instruction exactly.</myPT_system><myPT_user>Add [] around: emerald</myPT_user><myPT_assistant>
prompts.extract_inside: <myPT_system>You are MyPT. Execute the instruction exactly.</myPT_system><myPT_user>What's inside the quotes: "topaz"</myPT_user><myPT_assistant>
prompts.extract_quoted: <myPT_system>You are MyPT. Execute the instruction exactly.</myPT_system><myPT_user>Get the quoted part: "pearl"</myPT_user><myPT_assistant>

notes: These prompts use VAL templates (Parrot, Mirror, Add [] around, etc.) which are NOT in the training set. If the model gets these right, it has learned abstract operators.
